simplelist.member: The Java HotSpot Performance Engine Architecture

formalpara.title: No operator overloading
formalpara.para: For non-primitive types, operator can't be overloaded. For example, vectors can't be added as A + B, but only as A.plus(B). There are attractions in allowing operator overloading to support mathematical operations where the notation is close to the normal mathematical formalism and one can take advantage of the operator precedence rules.

formalpara.title: No automatic type narrowing.
formalpara.para: The type conversion which could lead to a loss of precision doesn't happen automatically, but variables must be cast explicitly. This protects the developer from certain hard-to-find bugs and makes the behaviour of the code explicit, but some may find it annoying.

bibliography.title: A Test Bibliography
bibliography.para: The stock stylesheet attempts to do a Bibliography. It probably needs a lot of tweaking. It probably doesn't conform to any specific style.
